active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs between achieving full supply chain transparency (e.g., mandatory SBOM sharing) and protecting vendor intellectual property or competitive advantages. Use examples from NIST CSF 2.0 GV.SC and real-world cases like SolarWinds to support arguments.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Supply Chain Transparency (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Threat Modeling > Advanced and Emerging Topics > Supply Chain and Third-Party Risk > Supply Chain Transparency). Use the provided learning objectives (spanning Bloom's Taxonomy: REMEMBER to CREATE), active learning components, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to generate high-quality, optimized flashcards. **Research Context (Complete and Expanded):** Supply chain transparency provides visibility into all lifecycle stages (design to disposal) to mitigate C-SCRM risks. Key frameworks: NIST SP 800-161r1 (practices for sourcing, assessment, integration); NIST CSF 2.0 Govern GV.SC (full outcomes: GV.SC-01: Establish C-SCRM strategy; GV.SC-02: Develop policies/procedures; GV.SC-03: Require third-party agreements; GV.SC-04: Define acquisition processes to become 'smart buyers'; GV.SC-05: Establish monitoring/response capabilities). ISO/IEC 27036: Supplier relationship security. Tools: SBOMs, VEX. Prerequisites: STRIDE threat modeling, basic supply chain logistics, risk management. Real-world: SolarWinds breach. Sources: NIST SP 800-161r1 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-161r1); NIST CSF 2.0 (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework); ISO/IEC 27036 (https://www.iso.org/standard/71139.html); CISA SCADA guidance. **Instructions:** Generate 50-75 flashcards strictly following the schema. Cover all objectives (at least 8-12 per Bloom's level), layers (12-15 each), and tie to active learning (e.g., scenario cards for problem-solving). Voter consensus: Ensure completeness (full NIST descriptions, sources), pedagogy (progressive Bloom's), scaffolding. Output ONLY in markdown format: ### Flashcard #1 **Front:** [Question] **Back:** - **Answer:** [...] - **Explanation:** [...] - **Bloom Level:** [...] - **Layer:** [...] - **Reference:** [...] Separate cards with ---. No intros or summaries.
